Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 4975941451da1d66a56e2cfe47ec7c6e9b8a4839

I tried this in our system1 simulation. It failed ("requestAdd: Sent to I2C failed after retries. busId=5, error=No such device or address") which I assume is expected but is there anyway to confirm we've got all the right parameters here for the ME_* commands?
Most of the parameters for ME commands are standard and a few are OEM (that's used in sbp1, which might not change for system1)
Should we always run the me_reset and disable of the FW_FLASH override gpio?

Yes, me_reset would help booting the system from the new firmware image that is flashed, else it will continue running the old fw version; disabling the GPIO is needed to protect the flash from further updation.
ok, so you'll add the call in this error path?
Done

Ahh darn, I should have been more specific, I think it would be better if we had a "cleanup()" function and we could call it from here as well as at the end of the function. That way we don't duplicate the logic and have to deal with bugs later if we need to change the cleanup.

Makes sense.

Done.
I think you still want that "exit 0" after the reset_and_cleanup_env call (so we don't run it again below).
Done

instead of disabling the check , we can change ME_CMD_RECOVER to an array instead of a string right ? likewise for all the other places ? 

```
ME_CMD_RECOVER=(1 0x2e 0 0xdf 4 0x57 0x01 0x00 0x01)

busctl call "$IPMB_OBJ" "$IPMB_PATH" "$IPMB_INTF" sendRequest yyyyay "${ME_CMD_RECOVER[@]}"

```
Done
I'm not finding this in the device tree. Is it something we need Ninad to get defined?
Yes. Notified Ninad about the same. Once the change is up, I will update it here.
It is updated and merged downstream. I will push it upstream soon.
Done

i think we should not install scripts like these in /usr/sbin - we seem to violate the antipattern https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/anti-patterns.md#incorrect-placement-of-executables-in-sbin-usrsbin-or-bin-usrbin
Done
Please put out in libexecdir, like https://grok.openbmc.org/xref/openbmc/openbmc/meta-phosphor/recipes-phosphor/users/phosphor-user-manager_git.bb?r=de1082b8#32
Done
